Sajar Tiwari (born 25 April 2011) is an Indian social activist and spiritual leader. He is best known as the founder and president of the Akhand Bharat Sanatan Sanghtan (A.B.S.S.), an organization aimed at the promotion and preservation of Sanatan Dharma and Indian cultural identity.
Early life
Sajar Tiwari was born on 25 April 2011 in Bihar, India. He is said to be a descendant of the Turhapati zamindari family, a historically prominent Brahmin landowning lineage in Champaran district. From a young age, Tiwari showed deep interest in Vedic teachings, Indian scriptures, and cultural history.
Career
Akhand Bharat Sanatan Sanghtan
In 2024, at the age of 13, Tiwari founded the Akhand Bharat Sanatan Sanghtan, a spiritual and cultural organization focused on reviving the core tenets of Hindu Dharma and uniting youth under the values of Sanatan tradition. The organization emphasizes cow protection, temple conservation, and spiritual awareness through educational outreach, cultural festivals, and public addresses.
Tiwari also actively engages with youth across India via digital platforms to spread messages rooted in Indian heritage, patriotism, and Vedic values.
Recognition
Though still young, Tiwari has gained a notable following online for his assertive stance on Hindu unity and revivalist ideologies. His speeches and campaigns have been featured across various regional social media platforms.
